name: tangia
steps: Place the 4 pieces of veal shank in the tangia (or a cast iron pot/thick tajine).
Add a bit of salt, ras el hanout, cumin, saffron, rancid butter, peeled garlic cut in half, the peel of the 2 small preserved lemons, a bit of olive oil, and the water.
Shake the pot to mix the spices.
Close the tangia with kraft paper and wire, make a few holes in the paper.
Cook in the ashes (traditional oven) or at a very low temperature (about 2 hours) until the meat is tender.
